titles.title: Washington-Lincoln Recognition Act of 2003
To recognize the birthdays of Presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Civil Service and Agency Organization.

bill.summary: 2/13/2003--Introduced. Washington-Lincoln Recognition Act of 2003 - States that (the legal public holiday) Washington's Birthday shall be referred to solely as such: (1) by all U.S. entities and officials; and (2) on all federally funded publications.Requests that the President issue an annual proclamation recognizing President Lincoln's birthday.
